tool.name: OpenSwathWorkflow
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir tr && ln -s '$tr' 'tr/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $tr.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($tr.ext)' && #if $tr_irt: mkdir tr_irt && ln -s '$tr_irt' 'tr_irt/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $tr_irt.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($tr_irt.ext)' && #end if #if $tr_irt_nonlinear: mkdir tr_irt_nonlinear && ln -s '$tr_irt_nonlinear' 'tr_irt_nonlinear/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $tr_irt_nonlinear.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($tr_irt_nonlinear.ext)' && #end if #if $swath_windows_file: mkdir swath_windows_file && ln -s '$swath_windows_file' 'swath_windows_file/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $swath_windows_file.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($swath_windows_file.ext)' && #end if #if "out_features_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_features && #end if #if "out_tsv_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_tsv && #end if #if "out_osw_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_osw && #end if #if "out_chrom_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_chrom && #end if #if "out_qc_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_qc && #end if #if "irt_mzml_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir Debugging_irt_mzml && #end if #if "irt_trafo_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir Debugging_irt_trafo && #end if ## advanced options #if $adv_opts.rt_norm: mkdir adv_opts.rt_norm && ln -s '$adv_opts.rt_norm' 'adv_opts.rt_norm/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $adv_opts.rt_norm.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($adv_opts.rt_norm.ext)' && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -tr 'tr/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $tr.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($tr.ext)' #if $tr_irt: -tr_irt 'tr_irt/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $tr_irt.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($tr_irt.ext)' #end if #if $tr_irt_nonlinear: -tr_irt_nonlinear 'tr_irt_nonlinear/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $tr_irt_nonlinear.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($tr_irt_nonlinear.ext)' #end if #if $swath_windows_file: -swath_windows_file 'swath_windows_file/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $swath_windows_file.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($swath_windows_file.ext)' #end if #if "out_features_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_features 'out_features/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' #end if #if "out_tsv_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_tsv 'out_tsv/output.${gxy2omsext("tabular")}' #end if #if "out_osw_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_osw 'out_osw/output.${gxy2omsext("osw")}' #end if #if "out_chrom_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_chrom 'out_chrom/output.${adv_opts.out_chrom_type}' #end if #if "out_qc_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_qc 'out_qc/output.${gxy2omsext("json")}' #end if #if "irt_mzml_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -Debugging:irt_mzml 'Debugging_irt_mzml/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' #end if #if "irt_trafo_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -Debugging:irt_trafo 'Debugging_irt_trafo/output.${gxy2omsext("trafoxml")}' #end if ## advanced options #if $adv_opts.rt_norm: -rt_norm 'adv_opts.rt_norm/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $adv_opts.rt_norm.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($adv_opts.rt_norm.ext)' #end if
#if len(str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',')) == 0 | tee '$stdout' #end if
## Postprocessing #if "out_features_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_features/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' '$out_features' #end if #if "out_tsv_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_tsv/output.${gxy2omsext("tabular")}' '$out_tsv' #end if #if "out_osw_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_osw/output.${gxy2omsext("osw")}' '$out_osw' #end if #if "out_chrom_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_chrom/output.${adv_opts.out_chrom_type}' '$out_chrom' #end if #if "out_qc_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_qc/output.${gxy2omsext("json")}' '$out_qc' #end if #if "irt_mzml_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'Debugging_irt_mzml/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' '$Debugging_irt_mzml' #end if #if "irt_trafo_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'Debugging_irt_trafo/output.${gxy2omsext("trafoxml")}' '$Debugging_irt_trafo' #end if #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.label: Input files separated by blank
param.help: select mzml,mzxml,sqmass data sets(s)

param.label: transition file ('TraML','tsv','pqp')
param.help: select pqp,tabular,traml data sets(s)

param.label: transition file ('TraML')
param.help: select pqp,tabular,traml data sets(s)

param.label: additional nonlinear transition file ('TraML')
param.help: select pqp,tabular,traml data sets(s)

param.label: Optional, tab-separated file containing the SWATH windows for extraction: lower_offset upper_offset
param.help: Note that the first line is a header and will be skipped select txt data sets(s)

param.label: data is scanning SWATH data
data is PASEF data
Only extract RT around this value (-1 means extract over the whole range, a value of 600 means to extract around +/- 300 s of the expected elution)
Extraction window in ion mobility dimension (in 1/k0 or milliseconds depending on library)
param.help: This is the full window size, e.g. a value of 10 milliseconds would extract 5 milliseconds on either side. -1 means extract over the whole range or ion mobility is not present. (Default for diaPASEF data: 0.06 1/k0)

param.label: Extraction window in Thomson or ppm (see mz_extraction_window_unit)
Extraction window used in MS1 in Thomson or ppm (see mz_extraction_window_ms1_unit)
Extraction window in ion mobility dimension for MS1 (in 1/k0 or milliseconds depending on library)
param.help: -1 means this is not ion mobility data

section.name: Calibration
section.title: Parameters for the m/z and ion mobility calibration

param.name: ms1_im_calibration
param.label: Whether to use MS1 precursor data for the ion mobility calibration (default = false, uses MS2 / fragment ions for calibration)

param.name: im_correction_function
param.label: Type of normalization function for IM calibration

param.name: debug_im_file
param.label: Debug file for Ion Mobility calibration

param.name: debug_mz_file
param.label: Debug file for m/z calibration

param.name: retentionTimeInterpretation
param.label: How to interpret the provided retention time (the retention time column can either be interpreted to be in iRT, minutes or seconds)

param.name: override_group_label_check
param.label: Override an internal check that assures that all members of the same PeptideGroupLabel have the same PeptideSequence (this ensures that only different isotopic forms of the same peptide can be grouped together in the same label group)
param.help: Only turn this off if you know what you are doing

param.name: force_invalid_mods
param.label: Force reading even if invalid modifications are encountered (OpenMS may not recognize the modification)

section.name: RTNormalization
section.title: Parameters for the RTNormalization for iRT petides
section.help: This specifies how the RT alignment is performed and how outlier detection is applied. Outlier detection can be done iteratively (by default) which removes one outlier per iteration or using the RANSAC algorithm

param.name: alignmentMethod
param.label: How to perform the alignment to the normalized RT space using anchor points
param.help: 'linear': perform linear regression (for few anchor points). 'interpolated': Interpolate between anchor points (for few, noise-free anchor points). 'lowess' Use local regression (for many, noisy anchor points). 'b_spline' use b splines for smoothing

param.name: outlierMethod
param.label: Which outlier detection method to use (valid: 'iter_residual', 'iter_jackknife', 'ransac', 'none')
param.help: Iterative methods remove one outlier at a time. Jackknife approach optimizes for maximum r-squared improvement while 'iter_residual' removes the datapoint with the largest residual error (removal by residual is computationally cheaper, use this with lots of peptides)

param.name: useIterativeChauvenet
param.label: Whether to use Chauvenet's criterion when using iterative methods
param.help: This should be used if the algorithm removes too many datapoints but it may lead to true outliers being retained

param.name: RANSACMaxIterations
param.label: Maximum iterations for the RANSAC outlier detection algorithm

param.name: RANSACMaxPercentRTThreshold
param.label: Maximum threshold in RT dimension for the RANSAC outlier detection algorithm (in percent of the total gradient)
param.help: Default is set to 3% which is around +/- 4 minutes on a 120 gradient

param.name: RANSACSamplingSize
param.label: Sampling size of data points per iteration for the RANSAC outlier detection algorithm

param.name: estimateBestPeptides
param.label: Whether the algorithms should try to choose the best peptides based on their peak shape for normalization
param.help: Use this option you do not expect all your peptides to be detected in a sample and too many 'bad' peptides enter the outlier removal step (e.g. due to them being endogenous peptides or using a less curated list of peptides)

param.name: InitialQualityCutoff
param.label: The initial overall quality cutoff for a peak to be scored (range ca

param.name: OverallQualityCutoff
param.label: The overall quality cutoff for a peak to go into the retention time estimation (range ca

param.name: NrRTBins
param.label: Number of RT bins to use to compute coverage
param.help: This option should be used to ensure that there is a complete coverage of the RT space (this should detect cases where only a part of the RT gradient is actually covered by normalization peptides)

param.name: MinPeptidesPerBin
param.label: Minimal number of peptides that are required for a bin to counted as 'covered'

param.name: MinBinsFilled
param.label: Minimal number of bins required to be covered

param.name: span
param.label: Span parameter for lowess

param.name: num_nodes
param.label: Number of nodes for b spline

param.name: stop_report_after_feature
param.label: Stop reporting after feature (ordered by quality; -1 means do not stop)

param.name: rt_normalization_factor
param.label: The normalized RT is expected to be between 0 and 1
param.help: If your normalized RT has a different range, pass this here (e.g. it goes from 0 to 100, set this value to 100)

param.name: quantification_cutoff
param.label: Cutoff in m/z below which peaks should not be used for quantification any more

param.name: write_convex_hull
param.label: Whether to write out all points of all features into the featureXML

param.name: spectrum_addition_method
param.label: For spectrum addition, either use simple concatenation or use peak resampling

param.name: add_up_spectra
param.label: Add up spectra around the peak apex (needs to be a non-even integer)

param.name: spacing_for_spectra_resampling
param.label: If spectra are to be added, use this spacing to add them up

param.name: uis_threshold_sn
param.label: S/N threshold to consider identification transition (set to -1 to consider all)

param.name: uis_threshold_peak_area
param.label: Peak area threshold to consider identification transition (set to -1 to consider all)

param.name: scoring_model
param.label: Scoring model to use

param.name: im_extra_drift
param.label: Extra drift time to extract for IM scoring (as a fraction
param.help: e.g. 0.25 means 25% extra on each side)

param.name: strict
param.label: Whether to error (true) or skip (false) if a transition in a transition group does not have a corresponding chromatogram

param.name: stop_after_feature
param.label: Stop finding after feature (ordered by intensity; -1 means do not stop)

param.name: min_peak_width
param.label: Minimal peak width (s), discard all peaks below this value (-1 means no action)

param.name: peak_integration
param.label: Calculate the peak area and height either the smoothed or the raw chromatogram data

param.name: background_subtraction
param.label: Remove background from peak signal using estimated noise levels
param.help: The 'original' method is only provided for historical purposes, please use the 'exact' method and set parameters using the PeakIntegrator: settings. The same original or smoothed chromatogram specified by peak_integration will be used for background estimation

param.name: recalculate_peaks
param.label: Tries to get better peak picking by looking at peak consistency of all picked peaks
param.help: Tries to use the consensus (median) peak border if the variation within the picked peaks is too large

param.name: use_precursors
param.label: Use precursor chromatogram for peak picking (note that this may lead to precursor signal driving the peak picking)

param.name: use_consensus
param.label: Use consensus peak boundaries when computing transition group picking (if false, compute independent peak boundaries for each transition)

param.name: recalculate_peaks_max_z
param.label: Determines the maximal Z-Score (difference measured in standard deviations) that is considered too large for peak boundaries
param.help: If the Z-Score is above this value, the median is used for peak boundaries (default value 1.0)

param.name: minimal_quality
param.label: Only if compute_peak_quality is set, this parameter will not consider peaks below this quality threshold

param.name: resample_boundary
param.label: For computing peak quality, how many extra seconds should be sample left and right of the actual peak

param.name: compute_peak_quality
param.label: Tries to compute a quality value for each peakgroup and detect outlier transitions
param.help: The resulting score is centered around zero and values above 0 are generally good and below -1 or -2 are usually bad

param.name: compute_peak_shape_metrics
param.label: Calculates various peak shape metrics
param.help: (e.g., tailing) that can be used for downstream QC/QA

param.name: compute_total_mi
param.label: Compute mutual information metrics for individual transitions that can be used for OpenSWATH/IPF scoring

param.name: boundary_selection_method
param.label: Method to use when selecting the best boundaries for peaks

param.name: sgolay_frame_length
param.label: The number of subsequent data points used for smoothing
param.help: This number has to be uneven. If it is not, 1 will be added

param.name: sgolay_polynomial_order
param.label: Order of the polynomial that is fitted

param.name: gauss_width
param.label: Gaussian width in seconds, estimated peak size

param.name: use_gauss
param.label: Use Gaussian filter for smoothing (alternative is Savitzky-Golay filter)

param.name: peak_width
param.label: Force a certain minimal peak_width on the data
param.help: (e.g. extend the peak at least by this amount on both sides) in seconds. -1 turns this feature off

param.name: signal_to_noise
param.label: Signal-to-noise threshold at which a peak will not be extended any more
param.help: Note that setting this too high (e.g. 1.0) can lead to peaks whose flanks are not fully captured

param.name: write_sn_log_messages
param.label: Write out log messages of the signal-to-noise estimator in case of sparse windows or median in rightmost histogram bin

param.name: remove_overlapping_peaks
param.label: Try to remove overlapping peaks during peak picking

param.name: method
param.label: Which method to choose for chromatographic peak-picking (OpenSWATH legacy on raw data, corrected picking on smoothed chromatogram or Crawdad on smoothed chromatogram)

param.name: integration_type
param.label: The integration technique to use in integratePeak() and estimateBackground() which uses either the summed intensity, integration by Simpson's rule or trapezoidal integration

param.name: baseline_type
param.label: The baseline type to use in estimateBackground() based on the peak boundaries
param.help: A rectangular baseline shape is computed based either on the minimal intensity of the peak boundaries, the maximum intensity or the average intensity (base_to_base)

param.name: fit_EMG
param.label: Fit the chromatogram/spectrum to the EMG peak model

param.name: dia_extraction_window
param.label: DIA extraction window in Th or ppm

param.name: dia_extraction_unit
param.label: DIA extraction window unit

param.name: dia_centroided
param.label: Use centroided DIA data

param.name: dia_byseries_intensity_min
param.label: DIA b/y series minimum intensity to conside

param.name: dia_byseries_ppm_diff
param.label: DIA b/y series minimal difference in ppm to conside

param.name: dia_nr_isotopes
param.label: DIA number of isotopes to conside

param.name: dia_nr_charges
param.label: DIA number of charges to conside

param.name: peak_before_mono_max_ppm_diff
param.label: DIA maximal difference in ppm to count a peak at lower m/z when searching for evidence that a peak might not be monoisotopic

param.name: max_iteration
param.label: Maximum number of iterations using by Levenberg-Marquardt algorithm

param.name: init_mom
param.label: Initialize parameters using method of moments estimators

param.name: use_shape_score
param.label: Use the shape score (this score measures the similarity in shape of the transitions using a cross-correlation)

param.name: use_coelution_score
param.label: Use the coelution score (this score measures the similarity in coelution of the transitions using a cross-correlation)

param.name: use_rt_score
param.label: Use the retention time score (this score measure the difference in retention time)

param.name: use_library_score
param.label: Use the library score

param.name: use_intensity_score
param.label: Use the intensity score

param.name: use_nr_peaks_score
param.label: Use the number of peaks score

param.name: use_total_xic_score
param.label: Use the total XIC score

param.name: use_total_mi_score
param.label: Use the total MI score

param.name: use_sn_score
param.label: Use the SN (signal to noise) score

param.name: use_mi_score
param.label: Use the MI (mutual information) score

param.name: use_dia_scores
param.label: Use the DIA (SWATH) scores
param.help: If turned off, will not use fragment ion spectra for scoring

param.name: use_ms1_correlation
param.label: Use the correlation scores with the MS1 elution profiles

param.name: use_sonar_scores
param.label: Use the scores for SONAR scans (scanning swath)

param.name: use_ion_mobility_scores
param.label: Use the scores for Ion Mobility scans

param.name: use_ms1_fullscan
param.label: Use the full MS1 scan at the peak apex for scoring (ppm accuracy of precursor and isotopic pattern)

param.name: use_ms1_mi
param.label: Use the MS1 MI score

param.name: use_uis_scores
param.label: Use UIS scores for peptidoform identification

param.name: use_ionseries_scores
param.label: Use MS2-level b/y ion-series scores for peptidoform identification

param.name: use_ms2_isotope_scores
param.label: Use MS2-level isotope scores (pearson & manhattan) across product transitions (based on ID if annotated or averagine)
RT normalization file (how to map the RTs of this run to the ones stored in the library)
param.help: If set, tr_irt may be omitted select trafoxml data sets(s)

param.label: Sort input SWATH files when matching to SWATH windows from swath_windows_file
Extract the precursor ion trace(s) and use for scoring if present
Enable additional scoring of identification assays using IPF (see online documentation)

param.name: out_chrom_type
param.label: File type of output out_chrom (Also output all computed chromatograms output in mzML (chrom.mzML) or sqMass (SQLite format))
Minimal distance to the upper edge of a Swath window to still consider a precursor, in Thomson
Output an XIC with a RT-window by this much large
param.help: (e.g. to visually inspect a larger area of the chromatogram)

param.label: Unit for mz extraction
Unit of the MS1 m/z extraction window
Also perform precursor extraction using the same ion mobility window as for fragment ion extraction
Assume the input data is targeted / PRM-like data with potentially overlapping DIA windows
param.help: Will only attempt to extract each assay from the *best* matching DIA window (instead of all matching windows)

param.label: Extraction window used for iRT and m/z correction in Thomson or ppm (see irt_mz_extraction_window_unit)
Unit for mz extraction
Ion mobility extraction window used for iRT (in 1/K0 or milliseconds depending on library)
param.help: -1 means do not perform ion mobility calibration

param.label: Minimum r-squared of RT peptides regression
Minimum relative amount of RT peptides to keep
The input files each contain one single SWATH (alternatively: all SWATH are in separate files)
Turn on elution model score (EMG fit to peak)
Whether to run OpenSWATH directly on the input data, cache data to disk first or to perform a datareduction step first
param.help: If you choose cache, make sure to also set tempDirectory

param.label: Use the retention time normalization peptide MS2 masses to perform a mass correction (linear, weighted by intensity linear or quadratic) of all spectra
Function used to extract the signal
The batch size of chromatograms to process (0 means to only have one batch, sensible values are around 250-1000)
The number of MS1 isotopes used for extraction
Overrides tool-specific checks
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs
param.option: out_chrom (Also output all computed chromatograms output in mzML (chrom.mzML) or sqMass (SQLite format))
out_qc (Optional QC meta data (charge distribution in MS1))
irt_mzml (Chromatogram mzML containing the iRT peptides)

data.name: out_features
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_features
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_features_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: out_tsv
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_tsv
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_tsv_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: out_osw
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_osw
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_osw_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: out_chrom
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_chrom
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_chrom_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: out_qc
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_qc
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_qc_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: Debugging_irt_mzml
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Debugging:irt_mzml
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "irt_mzml_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: Debugging_irt_trafo
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Debugging:irt_trafo
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "irt_trafo_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Complete workflow to run OpenSWATH
For more information, visit https://openms.de/doxygen/release/3.1.0/html/TOPP_OpenSwathWorkflow.html
